clinical_study.brief_title: Gastroenteritis in Pediatric Population of Qatar
clinical_study.official_title: Epidemiology of Acute Gastroenteritis in the Pediatric Population in Qatar: Causes, Risk Factors, Burden of Disease, Sources and Preventable Measures

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of clinical and laboratory diagnosis for cause of Gastroenteritis(GE) depending on the clinical manifestation.Identifying the sources of viral, bacterial and parasitic GE in Pediatric population of Qatar

detailed_description.textblock: Processing of stool samples by molecular method (PCR) for children with GE including complete data collection. Patients are followed up for 14 days

primary_outcome.measure: sources of viral, bacterial and parasitic GE in the country
primary_outcome.description: Prevalence of viral, bacterial and parasitic GE in children < 14 years of age in Qatar will be identified by molecular method sample processing

secondary_outcome.measure: seasonal variation of GE in qatar determination
secondary_outcome.description: seasonal variation of GE in qatar being determined by number of cases reported during each season

secondary_outcome.measure: comparing the prevalence of viral GE in vaccinated children in Qatar (against rotavirus) and the other countries which implemented rotavirus vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: comparing the prevalence of viral GE in vaccinated children in Qatar (against rotavirus) and the other countries which implemented rotavirus vaccine by detection of source of GE in vaccinated children by molecular method.

intervention.description: Stool samples are being processed through molecular method (PCR) for children with GE. Epidemiology of acute Gastroenteritis in the pediatric population in Qatar

study_pop.textblock: All acute gastroenteritis patients between 3 months to 14 years presenting to PEC centers with acute diarrhea+/- vomiting with or without fever

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All acute gastroenteritis patients between 3 months to 14 years presenting to PEC centers with acute diarrhea+/- vomiting with or without fever
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Cases of vomiting +/- fever only without diarrhea
2. Suspicion of surgical abdomen
3. Bile stained vomitus
4. Mal-absorption diseases as cystic fibrosis, celiac disease or increased secretion as disaccharides deficiency
5. Cases of Inflammatory bowel disease
6. Antibiotic associated diarrhea
7. Patients with immune deficiency
8. Patients with chronic diarrhea (>2 weeks of diarrhea)
9. Patients receiving long term medication for any disease
